self.assertEqual(inv.company_id, self.company_data['company'], 'invoices should be created in the company of the SO, not the main company of the context')

self.assertEqual(invoice.invoice_line_ids[0].price_unit, 75.0, 'membership: new subscription should create a line with the given price instead of product price')

self.assertEqual(invoice.invoice_line_ids[0].product_id, self.membership_1, 'membership: new subscription should create a line with the membership as product')

self.assertEqual(invoice.state, 'draft', 'membership: new subscription should create a draft invoice')

self.assertEqual(invoice_refund.move_type, 'out_invoice', 'The last created invoiced should be a customer invoice')

self.assertEqual(invoice_refund.move_type, 'out_refund', 'The last created invoiced should be a customer invoice')

self.assertEqual(invoice_refund.move_type, 'out_refund', 'The last created invoiced should be a refund')

self.assertEqual(len(challenge_lines), 3, '3 challenge_lines should be created')

self.assertEqual(len(challenges), 3, '3 challenges should be created')

self.assertEqual(len(channel), 1, "There can only be one channel created for 'Visitor Tour'.")

self.assertEqual(len(destination_lines), 2, 'Two lines should have been created on destination account: one for each currency (the lines with same partner and currency should have been aggregated)')

self.assertEqual(len(downpayment_line), 1, 'SO line downpayment should be created on SO')

self.assertEqual(len(downpayment_line), 2, 'SO line downpayment should be created on SO')

self.assertEqual(len(events), 1, 'It should have created 1 events')

self.assertEqual(len(events), 2, 'it should have created a recurrence with 2 events')

self.assertEqual(len(events), 3, 'It should have created 3 events')

self.assertEqual(len(events), 3, 'it should have created a recurrence with 3 events')
